corn_common_rust: Use fungicides like azoxystrobin or propiconazole. Rotate crops and plant rust-resistant varieties. Apply treatments early in the season when symptoms first appear.
corn_gray_leaf_spot: Apply foliar fungicides early and use crop rotation. Avoid continuous corn planting. Remove and destroy infected plant debris after harvest.
corn_healthy: Your corn plant is healthy! Maintain good irrigation and nutrient balance. Continue regular monitoring for early detection of diseases.
corn_northern_leaf_blight: Use resistant hybrids and apply fungicides during early infection stages. Practice crop rotation and remove infected debris.
potato_early_blight: Remove affected leaves and apply mancozeb or chlorothalonil fungicides. Ensure good soil drainage and avoid overhead watering. Rotate crops regularly.
potato_healthy: Potato plant is healthy. Maintain regular monitoring and balanced fertilization. Keep fields weed-free and ensure proper spacing.
potato_late_blight: Destroy infected plants immediately. Apply metalaxyl or copper-based fungicides. Improve air circulation and avoid waterlogged soil. Use certified seed potatoes.
rice_brown_spot: Use potassium-rich fertilizers. Apply tricyclazole or propiconazole fungicide. Maintain proper water management and avoid excessive nitrogen.
rice_healthy: Rice crop is healthy! Maintain proper spacing and nitrogen balance. Continue monitoring for pests and diseases.
rice_leaf_blast: Spray tricyclazole during early infection. Use resistant varieties. Maintain proper water levels and avoid excessive nitrogen fertilization.
rice_neck_blast: Apply fungicides like carbendazim and manage nitrogen usage. Use resistant varieties and practice crop rotation. Remove infected plant debris.
sugarcane_bacterial_blight: Use disease-free setts and apply copper-based bactericides. Avoid waterlogging and ensure good drainage. Practice crop rotation and remove infected plants.
sugarcane_healthy: Sugarcane crop is healthy. Maintain optimal irrigation and pest control. Monitor regularly for signs of disease.
sugarcane_red_rot: Use resistant varieties and treat seed sets with carbendazim before planting. Avoid waterlogging and ensure proper field drainage. Remove and destroy infected stalks.
wheat_brown_rust: Use resistant wheat varieties and apply fungicides like propiconazole or tebuconazole. Remove volunteer wheat plants and practice crop rotation.
wheat_healthy: Wheat crop is healthy! Continue regular monitoring for pests and diseases. Maintain proper fertilization and irrigation.
wheat_yellow_rust: Apply fungicides (tebuconazole or propiconazole) and use rust-resistant varieties. Remove volunteer wheat and practice crop rotation. Monitor fields regularly during growing season.
